heading: gates fights child killer
subheading: the gates foundation donates us$26 million toward the eradication of neonatal tetanus in the third world.
author: reuters
text: the bill and melinda gates foundation has donated us$26 million to a united nations charity that aims to eliminate tetanus among impoverished mothers and children. the grant to unicef will make immunizations more widely available in developing countries, where the disease claimed nearly 250,000 lives -- most of them infants -- in 1998. only one us newborn died of tetanus in the same year, according to the us committee for unicef.mothers in poor nations often become infected by the tetanus bacteria while undergoing gynecological procedures, including childbirth, in unsanitary conditions. babies are often infected when the umbilical cord is severed.unicef experts say death from tetanus can be torturous, with victims suffering spasms, stiffness, and the inability to breathe.copyright
